alert.note: Alert for Dundy; Hitchcock; Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 21 at 4:06AM CST until December 23 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM MST /NOON CST/ THIS MORNING TO 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 AM MST /NOON CST/ FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chill readings as low as 50 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow and blowing snow. Total snow accumulations ranging anywhere from a dusting to 2 inches are expected. Locally heavier amounts are possible. North winds at 30 to 45 mph will gust up to 55 mph this evening into Thursday. * WHERE...Entire Tri-State area. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, sunset this evening through noon on Friday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, mainly between sunset this evening and sunset Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Dangerous travel conditions. Life threatening cold temperatures and wind chill readings. Frostbite may occur on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A brief period of freezing drizzle cannot be ruled out along and east of Highway 83 in Kansas late this morning. Otherwise, a west to east oriented band of snow will develop around or shortly after sunset... progressing southward through the area this evening. Localized blizzard conditions are possible for a few hours, mainly along and north of Interstate 70 between 5 pm and Midnight MST. Snow will end from north to south between Midnight and sunrise Thursday morning. Strong northerly winds and blowing snow will persist through the day on Thursday.
info.instruction: Life threatening cold temperatures and wind chill readings are expected. Avoid outdoor activities, if possible. If you must venture outdoors, make sure to wear appropriate clothing. Dress in multiple layers, including a hat and gloves. At these extreme temperatures, frostbite may occur on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes. Dangerous travel conditions associated with snow and blowing snow are anticipated this evening into tonight. Consider alternate travel plans. If you must travel... carry a winter survival kit. Survival kits should include warm clothes, boots, blankets, a flashlight with extra batteries and candy bars or cereal bars. Always carry a charged cell phone... and tell others of your travel plans. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
